name: Peruvian Salmon Ceviche
author: Maria_de_Cuba
summary: This ceviche recipe is from my husband's family from Peru. The ceviche is made with salmon, shrimp, and of course, lots of lime juice. You can substitute other fish, like tilapia, as well. Use fewer chile peppers (or remove the seeds) if you don't like it too spicy. In Peru, it is generally eaten with sweet potatoes.
ingredients: 4 cups uncooked medium shrimp, peeled and deveined
1 (4 inch) piece fresh ginger root, peeled and chopped
directions: Combine salmon and shrimp in a large glass bowl
Combine 2 quarts water and 1/4 cup sea salt; stir until salt has dissolved
Pour salt water over salmon and shrimp and set aside for 30 minutes
Mix onions and remaining 1/4 cup sea salt in a bowl and cover with remaining cold water
Combine lime juice, celery, ginger, garlic, and chile peppers in a blender; blend until smooth
Rinse salmon and shrimp in a sieve under running cold water to wash off the salt
Mix salmon, shrimp, and onions in a large bowl
Serve garnished with fresh cilantro, lettuce leaves, and lime wedges
